nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as page_token to retrieve the next page of reports. If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

pathFilters.description: Path Filters. There is a limit of 100 path filters that can be set per report.

PathQueryOptions.description: Path Query Options for Report Options.

disjunctiveMatchStatements.description: DisjunctiveMatchStatements within a Rule. DisjunctiveMatchStatement OR's all contained filters.

Rule.description: A Rule defines a name, and a boolean expression in [conjunctive normal form] (http://mathworld.wolfram.com/ConjunctiveNormalForm.html){.external} that can be applied to a path event to determine if that name should be applied.

filter.description: Dimension the filter is applied to.

enumDescriptions: Default value when match is not specified or is unknown in this version.
Matches a value, utilizing wildcard character logic in the value.

month.description: Month of a year. Must be from 1 to 12, or 0 to specify a year without a month and day.

day.description: Day of a month. Must be from 1 to 31 and valid for the year and month, or 0 to specify a year by itself or a year and month where the day isn't significant.

year.description: Year of the date. Must be from 1 to 9999, or 0 to specify a date without a year.

Date.description: Represents a whole or partial calendar date, such as a birthday. The time of day and time zone are either specified elsewhere or are insignificant. The date is relative to the Gregorian Calendar. This can represent one of the following: * A full date, with non-zero year, month, and day values. * A month and day, with a zero year (for example, an anniversary). * A year on its own, with a zero month and a zero day. * A year and month, with a zero day (for example, a credit card expiration date). Related types: * google.type.TimeOfDay * google.type.DateTime * google.protobuf.Timestamp

PathFilter.description: Path filters specify which paths to include in a report. A path is the result of combining DV360 events based on User ID to create a workflow of users' actions. When a path filter is set, the resulting report will only include paths that match the specified event at the specified position. All other paths will be excluded.

enumDescriptions: Default value when path match position is not specified or is unknown in this version.
The first position in the path.
The last position in the path.
pathMatchPosition.description: The position of the path the filter should match to (first, last, or any event in path).

eventFilters.description: Filter on an event to be applied to some part of the path.

RunQueryRequest.description: Request to run a stored query to generate a report.

dataRange.description: Report data range used to generate the report. If unspecified, the original parent query's data range is used.

googleCloudStoragePath.description: Output only. The path to the location in Google Cloud Storage where the report is stored.

reportDataEndDate.description: The ending time for the data that is shown in the report.

reportDataStartDate.description: The starting time for the data that is shown in the report.

customStartDate.description: The starting data for the data that is shown in the report. Note, `customStartDate` is required if `range` is `CUSTOM_DATES` and ignored otherwise.

range.description: Report data range used to generate the report.
enumDescriptions: Default value when range is not specified or is unknown in this version.
Custom range specified by custom_start_date and custom_end_date fields.
All days, including the current day, since the most recent Sunday.
All days, including the current day, since the start of the current month.
All days, including the current day, since the start of the current quarter.
All days, including the current day, since the start of the current calendar year.
The previous completed week, beginning from Sunday.
The previous 7 days, excluding the current day.
The previous 30 days, excluding the current day.
The previous 90 days, excluding the current day.
The previous 365 days, excluding the current day.
All time for which data is available, excluding the current day.
The previous 14 days, excluding the current day.
The previous 60 days, excluding the current day.

customEndDate.description: The ending date for the data that is shown in the report. Note, `customEndDate` is required if `range` is `CUSTOM_DATES` and ignored otherwise.

DisjunctiveMatchStatement.description: DisjunctiveMatchStatement that OR's all contained filters.

eventFilters.description: Filters. There is a limit of 100 filters that can be set per disjunctive match statement.

rules.description: Rules within Channel Grouping. There is a limit of 100 rules that can be set per channel grouping.

fallbackName.description: The name to apply to an event that does not match any of the rules in the channel grouping.

ChannelGrouping.description: A channel grouping defines a set of rules that can be used to categorize events in a path report.

finishTime.description: Output only. The time when this report either completed successfully or failed.

state.description: Output only. The state of the report.
enumDescriptions: Default value when state is not specified or is unknown in this version.
The report is queued to run.
The report has finished running successfully.
The report has finished running in failure.

format.description: The file type of the report.
enumDescriptions: Default value when format is not specified or is unknown in this version.

Parameters.description: Parameters of a query or report.

type.description: The type of the report. The type of the report will dictate what dimesions, filters, and metrics can be used.
enumDescriptions: Default value when report type is not specified or is unknown in this version.

metrics.description: Metrics to include as columns in your report.

filters.description: Filters used to match traffic data in your report.

groupBys.description: Data is grouped by the filters listed in this field.

EventFilter.description: Defines the type of filter to be applied to the path, a DV360 event dimension filter.

schedule.description: Information on how often and when to run a query. If `ONE_TIME` is set to the frequency field, the query will only be run at the time of creation.

key.description: Key used to identify a report.

enumDescriptions: Default value when format is not specified or is unknown in this version.

title.description: Query title. It is used to name the reports generated from this query.

shareEmailAddress.description: List of email addresses which are sent email notifications when the report is finished. Separate from send_notification.

sendNotification.description: Whether to send an email notification when a report is ready. Defaults to false.

dataRange.description: Range of report data. All reports will be based on the same time zone as used by the advertiser.

FilterPair.description: Filter used to match traffic data in your report.

pathQueryOptions.description: Options that contain Path Filters and Custom Channel Groupings.

includeOnlyTargetedUserLists.description: Set to true and filter your report by `FILTER_INSERTION_ORDER` or `FILTER_LINE_ITEM` to include data for audience lists specifically targeted by those items.

startDate.description: When to start running the query. Not applicable to `ONE_TIME` frequency.

enumDescriptions: Default value when frequency is not specified or is unknown in this version.
frequency.description: How often the query is run.

nextRunTimezoneCode.description: Canonical timezone code for report generation time. Defaults to `America/New_York`.

endDate.description: Date to periodically run the query until. Not applicable to `ONE_TIME` frequency.

QuerySchedule.description: Information on when and how frequently to run a query.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as page_token to retrieve the next page of queries. If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

ReportKey.description: Key used to identify a report.

description: DoubleClick Bid Manager API allows users to manage and create campaigns and reports.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

reportId.description: Required. ID of the report to retrieve.

queryId.description: Required. ID of the query the report is associated with.

list.description: Lists reports associated with a query.

pageToken.description: A page token, received from a previous list call. Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page of reports.

pageSize.description: Maximum number of results per page. Must be between `1` and `100`. Defaults to `100` if unspecified.

orderBy.description: Name of a field used to order results. The default sorting order is ascending. To specify descending order for a field, append a " desc" suffix. For example "key.reportId desc". Sorting is only supported for the following fields: * `key.reportId`

queryId.description: Required. ID of the query with which the reports are associated.

list.description: Lists queries created by the current user.

pageToken.description: A page token, received from a previous list call. Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page of queries.

pageSize.description: Maximum number of results per page. Must be between `1` and `100`. Defaults to `100` if unspecified.

orderBy.description: Name of a field used to order results. The default sorting order is ascending. To specify descending order for a field, append a " desc" suffix. For example "metadata.title desc". Sorting is only supported for the following fields: * `queryId` * `metadata.title`

delete.description: Deletes a query as well as the associated reports.

queryId.description: Required. ID of query to delete.

run.description: Runs a stored query to generate a report.

synchronous.description: Whether the query should be run synchronously. When true, this method will not return until the query has finished running. When false or not specified, this method will return immediately.

queryId.description: Required. ID of query to run.
Required. ID of query to retrieve.

title: DoubleClick Bid Manager API
name: doubleclickbidmanager

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/doublecl.description: View and manage your reports in DoubleClick Bid Manager
